value.title: IBM's new 2-nm chips have transistors smaller than a strand of DNA
value.excerpt: In a shining example of the inexorable march of technology, IBM has unveiled new semiconductor chips with the smallest transistors ever made. The new 2-nanometer (nm) tech allows the company to cram a staggering 50 billion transistors onto a chip the size of a fingernail.

value.title: False facial recognition sends innocent New Jersey man to jail
value.excerpt: New Jersey police arrested an innocent man on unlawful possession of a weapon, resisting arrest and aggravated assault charges after he was falsely identified by facial recognition technology.
